#Text=Maintain Mental Health
#Text=with Exercise
#Text=There is a lot of proof that exercise will benefit your mental health and creativity .
#Text=But what are the best exercises for maintaining a healthy mind and body ?
#Text=Here are some tips but know that the most important thing is to stay consistent , listen to your body and know what 's best for you .
#Text=Steps
#Text=Casual exercises
#Text=Go for a walk routinely .
#Text=This is the easiest way of exersising , which will not only keep your body moving but also relaxes your mind
#Text=Spare around 10-60minutes each day to just wander around the block or a park nearby
#Text=Listen to some music or podcasts
#Text=Try walking meditation
#Text=Jogging .
#Text=Light running can free your mind and achieving certain distances can boost your serotonin level , which will keep up your overall happiness
#Text=Plan around 10-60minutes each day to jog around the block or in a nearby park
#Text=Listen to motivational music or try guided runs via apps
#Text=Begin small by starting to run 10minutes and increase it slowly
#Text=Do n't push yourself to run a certain distance in a certain time
#Text=Cycling .
#Text=Just like the previous exercises this one not only improves your stamina but also reliefs your mind from tension .
#Text=Get yourself a bike .
#Text=It does'nt have to be an overly expensive one
#Text=Plan to cycle to work , school or anywhere else
#Text=Start slow and organize more time for your ride than the GPS estimates .
#Text=This will reduce stress .
#Text=Be safe .
#Text=Wear a helmet and look out for car drivers , traffic lights and signs .
#Text=Gym exersises
#Text=Extended light cardio .
#Text=Go on a treadmill , stationary bike or stairmaster
#Text=Plan around 30minutes for your workout
#Text=Take it easy by setting a low speed or resistance
#Text=Listen to music or podcasts but do n't watch a series or a movie as this will occupy your mind .
#Text=Follow a training plan or routine .
#Text=Ask a trainer to help you with a plan perfected for your desired results .
#Text=This will help you with motivation to go to the gym .
#Text=Use your phone only to listen to music .
#Text=Do n't scroll through social media while resting in between laps .
#Text=Focus on the exercise , not the surrounding and the people .
#Text=This way your mind does't wander and you get trough your exercises more quickly .
#Text=Ultimate mental health exercises
#Text=Yoga .
#Text=As stereotypical as it seems yoga is the best way to ground yourself , improve your flexibility and boost your mental health .
#Text=With elements similar to meditation it offers deep relaxation while exercising .
#Text=Try out a yoga class at your gym .
#Text=Most gym memberships include classes such as yoga class .
#Text=Look at the schedule and visit one .
#Text=You wo n't find scrawny models or grandmas but rather the regular people you see at the gym .
#Text=Try guided yoga routines at home .
#Text=Tai chi .
#Text=Just like yoga it helps you stay connective to your body , control your movement and relax your mind .
#Text=Consider tai chi classes
#Text=Try out a free first lesson to see if it fits you
#Text=Tips
#Text=Do n't push your limits and overpower your body while exercising .
#Text=Be sure to rest appropriately and do n't be so hard on yourself if you only lift light weights or run slowly .
#Text=Your mental health is more important than what others think of you
